comments.body: I love that you added a short explanation to the two properties above. Can we do the same for this one and the one below so people don't have to click through?
Sure.  Done, and for scan code.  Unfortunately, there really isn't a lot of information even in the Android docs about these.
Is there value in making these all part of the public interface? If yes, should these include a "see also" to link people to the more convenient methods of determining these things?

There is marginal value: we expose the `metaState` variable, so if you actually want to know what state is represented there, these masks will tell you.  Added a sentence to each of these referring tot he "easier" way.
After reading this comment I am wondering how a dev should deal with key events in a platform-agnostic way. Maybe add a short link/comment around this?

The short answer is: they can't yet.

That's my next focus: making a platform-independent representation called `LogicalKeyEvent`, and this work is really to help support that.
